speaker: Daniel
text: *Daniel leans in with a smirk.* So, Mary, tell me... what's the secret to staying so focused in class? I always see you so engrossed in the lectures.

speaker: Mary
text: *Mary chuckles, swirling her drink in her hand.* No secret, really. Just lots of coffee and a fascination for what I'm studying, I suppose.

speaker: Daniel
text: *Daniel laughs lightly, his eyes twinkling.* Sounds like a winning combination. I might try that sometime.

speaker: Mary
text: *Mary laughs, raising her eyebrows in challenge.* Go for it, but remember: it's not for the faint of heart.

speaker: Daniel
text: *Daniel grins, his eyes never leaving Mary's.* Challenge accepted, Mary.

speaker: Daniel
text: *Daniel leans back in his chair, his eyes looking Mary up and down.* You know, it's not just your mind I find attractive, Mary.

speaker: Mary
text: *Mary blushes slightly, laughing it off.* Well, thank you. I've been told I have a strong personality.

speaker: Daniel
text: *Daniel smirks, leaning in closer.* That's not what I meant, and you know it. You're attractive, Mary. Very attractive.

speaker: Mary
text: *Mary's cheeks burn brighter, her laughter a little louder.* I'll take that as a compliment then. Cheers to that, Daniel!

speaker: Daniel
text: *Daniel raises his glass to clink with Mary's.* Cheers to beautiful and smart women who don't realize their worth.

speaker: Daniel
text: *Daniel finishes his drink, his eyes twinkling with mischief.* So about our bet... The winner gets a wish granted. Are you still in?

speaker: Mary
text: *Mary raises an eyebrow, a playful smile dancing on her lips.* Of course! I love a good challenge, you know that.

speaker: Daniel
text: *Daniel grins, his gaze intensifying.* I hope you're ready to fulfill my wish, Mary. I'm pretty good at pool.

speaker: Mary
text: *Mary chuckles, her eyes sparkling with determination.* We'll see about that, Daniel. I've been known to surprise people.

speaker: Daniel
text: *Daniel grins confidently as he lines up his shot, already imagining his victory.* So, when I win... What should I wish for? Maybe something you'll blush at, Mary?

speaker: Mary
text: *Mary laughs lightly, rolling her eyes at his playful arrogance.* You're counting your chickens before they hatch, aren't you?

speaker: Daniel
text: *Daniel leans in to take his shot, but it goes wide, and he ends up missing.* Well... That was unexpected.

speaker: Mary
text: *Mary smirks, taking the cue in her hands and starting to pocket her own balls.* Don't worry, Daniel. We all have our off days.

speaker: Mary
text: *With only the eight-ball left, Mary takes a moment to address Daniel.* If I win... We're going out again next week. And you're picking up the tab.

speaker: Mary
text: *Mary sinks the eight-ball into the called pocket, the crowd around them cheering.* Looks like you're buying dinner next week, Daniel!
